section_purpose: To present and analyze experimental results comparing different variants of oracle-based stochastic local search (SLS) solvers, demonstrating performance improvements and insights from trained oracles.
key_points: Full oracle-based algorithm outperforms uniform and hybrid variants for both MT and WalkSAT solvers across all metrics.
WalkSAT dominates the MT algorithm in performance for each variant.
Significant speed-ups are observed in median steps required, with factors of more than 8 for MT and around 5 for WalkSAT, indicating effectiveness on simpler instances.
Access to GNN-based oracle shifts performance curves for α values (around 3.0 to 3.2), increasing the average α for solved instances by 17%.
The hybrid variant loses its initial advantage quickly, highlighting the importance of continuous oracle access during solving.
dependencies: Section 2 for algorithms and theoretical foundations (Propositions 2.1, 2.2)
Appendix A.2 for detailed experimental plots
reproducibility_notes: Details on algorithm variants (uniform, hybrid, full) and their implementation
Specification of loss terms (Lovász local loss and Gibbs loss) used in training
Performance metrics reported (median steps, mean steps, α values, ratio of solved instances)
